questions.question_text: Which command can check a AAA server authentication for server group Group1, user cisco, and password cisco555 on a Cisco ASA device?

choices.C: ASA# aaa-server authorization Group1 username cisco password cisco555
choices.D: ASA# aaa-server authentication Group1 roger cisco555
choices.B: ASA# test aaa-server authentication group Group1 username cisco password cisco555
choices.A: ASA# test aaa-server authentication Group1 username cisco password cisco555

choices.D: Adjustable 802.1X timers to enable successful authentication
choices.B: Per user dACLs applied after successful authentication
choices.A: Granular ACLs applied prior to authentication
choices.C: Only EAPoL traffic allowed prior to authentication

questions.question_text: Cisco 802.1X phasing enables flexible deployments through the use of open, low-impact, and closed modes. What is a unique characteristic of the most secure mode?

discussion.content:
Trust Sec How to Guides: Closed Mode:
Figure 3 Closed Mode Default 802.1X Port Behavior
In Closed Mode, the switchport does not allow any traffic except EAP over LAN (EAPoL) until a successful authentication takes place. There is no concept of pre-authentication access, which means that no access is allowed—such as Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP), HTTP, and Domain Name System (DNS)—while authentication is in progress. Closed Mode can be useful for VLAN-based enforcement since the client does not get an IP address until they have been successfully authenticated.

Cisco ISE Administration guide 2.6 page 87:
Specify System Time and NTP Server Settings
Before you begin
You must have either the Super Admin or System Admin administrator role assigned.
If you have both a primary and a secondary Cisco ISE node, you must log in to the user interface of the
secondary node and configure the system time and NTP server settings on each Cisco ISE node in your
deployment individually.

questions.question_text: Which statement about system time and NTP server configuration with Cisco ISE is true?

choices.B: The system time can be configured centrally on the Cisco ISE, but NTP server settings must be configured individually on each ISE node.
choices.C: NTP server settings can be configured centrally on the Cisco ISE, but the system time must be configured individually on each ISE node.
choices.D: The system time and NTP server settings must be configured individually on each ISE node.
choices.A: The system time and NTP server settings can be configured centrally on the Cisco ISE.

questions.question_text: Wireless client supplicants attempting to authenticate to a wireless network are generating excessive log messages. Which three WLC authentication settings should be disabled? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Cisco ISE Admin guide 2.6 page 43:
Recommended WLC Timer Settings
We recommend setting the following timers on the WLC that you plan to use with Wireless Setup. The settings
are shown in CLI.
config radius auth retransmit-timeout {SERVER_INDEX} 5
config radius aggressive-failover disable
config radius fallback-test mode passive
config wlan exclusionlist {WLAN ID} 180
config wlan exclusionlist {WLAN ID} enabled

IEEE 802.11i-2004, or 802.11i for short, is an amendment to the original IEEE 802.11, implemented as Wi-Fi Protected Access II (WPA2). The draft standard was ratified on 24 June 2004. This standard specifies security mechanisms for wireless networks, replacing the short Authentication and privacy clause of the original standard with a detailed Security clause. In the process, the amendment deprecated broken Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP), while it was later incorporated into the published IEEE 802.11-2007 standard.

questions.question_text: What is another term for 802.11i wireless network security?
